name: Game Character Creator
description: Build a role-playing game character system using classes and inheritance. Create a base Character class with health and attack methods, then create a Warrior subclass with special abilities. This project teaches how to organize code with classes, use __init__ to set up objects, and extend functionality with inheritance.
learning_goals: Use self to access instance attributes
Define methods that operate on object data
Implement inheritance to extend class functionality

steps.instruction: Create a class called Character. Define the __init__ method that takes three parameters: self, name, and health. Inside __init__, assign name to self.name and health to self.health.
steps.hint: Use def __init__(self, name, health): followed by self.name = name and self.health = health

steps.instruction: Add a method called display_stats to the Character class. It should take only self as a parameter. Use print() to display the exact text: "Name: " followed by self.name, then on a new line print "Health: " followed by self.health.
steps.hint: Define the method with def display_stats(self): and use two print() statements with f-strings or concatenation

steps.instruction: Add a method called attack to the Character class. It should take only self as a parameter. Use print() to display the exact text: the value of self.name followed by " attacks for 10 damage!"
steps.hint: Define the method with def attack(self): and use a print statement with an f-string
steps.solution:
def attack(self):
        print(f"{self.name} attacks for 10 damage!")

steps.instruction: Create an instance of Character called hero with the name "Aria" and health 100. Store it in a variable called hero. Then call the display_stats method on hero.
Call the attack method on hero.
steps.expected_output:
Name: Aria
Health: 100
Aria attacks for 10 damage!

steps.instruction: Create a new class called Warrior that inherits from Character. Use class Warrior(Character): and add pass on the next line for now.
steps.hint: Put the class name in parentheses after Warrior to inherit: class Warrior(Character):
steps.expected_output:
Name: Aria
Health: 100
Aria attacks for 10 damage!

steps.instruction: Replace the pass statement in the Warrior class with a method called special_attack. It should take only self as a parameter. Use print() to display the exact text: the value of self.name followed by " uses Power Strike for 25 damage!"
steps.hint: Remove pass and add def special_attack(self): with a print statement
steps.expected_output:
Name: Aria
Health: 100
Aria attacks for 10 damage!
steps.solution:
def special_attack(self):
        print(f"{self.name} uses Power Strike for 25 damage!")

steps.instruction: Create an instance of Warrior called fighter with the name "Brutus" and health 150. Store it in a variable called fighter. Call display_stats on fighter, then call attack on fighter, and finally call special_attack on fighter.
steps.hint: Use fighter = Warrior("Brutus", 150) then call the three methods
steps.expected_output:
Name: Aria
Health: 100
Aria attacks for 10 damage!
Name: Brutus
Health: 150
Brutus attacks for 10 damage!
Brutus uses Power Strike for 25 damage!
